column5: i hope that miss bubba heals up real fast and she is in top shape for the new year,meery christmas green coach,from our family to yours,and miss bubba too

Great to see her at home and recovering!!!  I've known a few 3 legged dogs over the years...and you'd never know it...the way they'd play and run.  Thanks for the update...I had been wondering about her.  Merry Christmas!  blyght and ccmtcanada

She's a great looking pup Dawg, and looks like she'll be a handfull to boot .  Glad to hear she's home for the holidays with you, where she belongs!  Spoil her a bit for me and my boys will ya?  Merry Christmas  Maureen

That is so sad GCD. But at the same time, a heart warming story. She is such a sweet looking dog. As you probably know, I have two Borders. They are incredible dogs. Miss Bubba will adapt and she'll be just fine. Give her a treat from me please!!
Glad to hear the little pooch is doing fine  She is a good looking pup!  Whopper

Thanks Glen  Great to hear Miss Bubba's gonna be OK now, and hopefully, she'll adapt nicely without any real probems and go on to live a long and normal life.  Must be a nice for you guys, knowing everything is good now and you have her home in time for Christmas.  Marvin sends his luv too

Its a little bit of good news and bad news GCD. Had a nieghbour's dog  that lost a leg when it chased down a lawnmower and lost. The good news............everything will be very close to normal. The bad news............rabbits and varmints will soon learn that all they have to do is turn right instead of left and they can lose her Poor Miss Bubba!! Seriously, glad to hear things are going so well.  A great Christmas gift.
Great to hear, Glenner...  Merry Christmas, Captain Redneck....
Great news Glen, I'm sure that she will do just fine. She is a lucky dog who has a great life ahead with someone a caring as you.  Have a great holiday...  John
I am glad to hear your little baby girl is doing fine.I know at times things can be tough,Myself I treat my dogs as they were my kids.Were I go they go and if they cant go I stay home.
She will do just fine Glenn.. Thanks for letting us all know how she is doing..
Glen, Glad to here Missie is back home and healthy.... Give her a big hug from Arnie  Cheers !!!
That's great news.
Give Miss Bubba a big hug for me bud.Merry Christmas to you and yours. Joe
....Great looking dog you got there GCD and she's real lucky to have you and the Missus seeing she gets the care she deserves. Good on you both.  Merry Christmas.

It was one year ago today that Amy ( also a border collie )  had surgery that saved her life...she is doing great and I'm sure Miss Bubba will be fine.  Borders are the smartest dogs according to the experts and can adapt to most things that they are faced with.  You'll never regret sticking by her after the accident.  One thing that amazes me is the resiliency of dogs after surgery.  I'm sure I wouldn't be as active as she is after just 24 hours. Have a great Christmas and give her a pet from us.
That's great news.  A special gift for xmas.
Nice work she's looking strong. Looks like you made the right decision.  Congrats  Adapt, improvise,overcome.
Glad to hear things are going OK Glen, she's a beautiful dog.
Glad to hear she is recovering Glen! I have also seen 3 legged dogs that seemed to get around fine. Good Luck Miss Bubba!
Glen, thanks for the update and we are very happy to hear Miss Bubba is doing well after the surgery.  She is a beautiful looking dog.  Spoil her lots of the holidays.  Merry Christmas
GCD,  I'm glad to hear the pup is doing good and you have a smile on your face now too! Merry Christmas!  - Steven
great looking puppy.  I am glad that she is adapting well to her new life.  Good for you and the Missus to stick it through, others would have quit.
Good to hear she's back home and doing well.
